intro: Stenoloma goudotianum, commonly known as the Goudoti fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its rhizome is creeping and produces numerous small, spore-bearing leaves. The botanical features of Stenoloma goudotianum make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
